questions.question: At least six people have ……………….. in the explosion.
questions.description: Died is the past tense of die.

questions.question: By the time they found him, he was already ……………………….
questions.description: Dead is an adjective. Died is a verb.

questions.question: She …………………… in the morning.
questions.description: The simple past is used when we say when something happened.

questions.question: Let’s ………………………. your plans.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that are not followed by a preposition.

questions.question: I …………………… him a visit the other day.
questions.description: Paid is the past tense of pay.

questions.question: She …………………….. her dress and went out.
questions.description: To put on dress is to wear it.

questions.question: What a brilliant idea ……………………..!
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in exclamations.

questions.question: Tell me why ………………………. to leave now.
questions.description: The inverted word order is used in indirect questions.

questions.question: You ……………………… listen to your doctor.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice or warnings.

questions.question: If you started early, you …………………….. miss the bus.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: A cousin of ………………….. is an actor.
